perturbation.original_text: "Acceptance" or "Accepted"      Means acceptance of any part or the whole of the                                       System by the Publishers when the System                                       has successfully passed the acceptance                                       tests in accordance with Clause 9 below                                       but for the avoidance of doubt does not                                       refer to the continuing Services after the                                       Site goes live
perturbation.changed_text: "Acceptance" or "Accepted"      Means initial acknowledgment of any part of the                                       System by the Publishers, regardless of whether the System                                       has passed acceptance tests. This definition                                       applies to all stages of the project,                                       including ongoing services after the                                       Site goes live.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition specifies a clear condition ('successfully passed the acceptance tests') for acceptance. The modified version broadens 'Acceptance' to mean any initial acknowledgment, removing the requirement for successful testing and including ongoing services. This contradicts the standard definition of acceptance in contract law, which usually implies meeting specific criteria or standards.  It creates uncertainty as to when HealthGate has met its obligations.

perturbation.original_text: the "Services"                  the services to be performed by HealthGate to be                                       set out in the Specification, to include                                       but not limited to (i) any ongoing work in                                       the design and development of the Site;                                       (ii) mounting the Content on HealthGate's                                       Hardware; (iii) hosting and making the                                       Content and portions thereof accessible in                                       an online interactive mode for searching,                                       access, review, displaying in a web                                       browser or on computer terminals,                                       downloading, and printing on paper and;                                       (iv) providing access to Publishers'                                       subscribers and other third parties to the                                       Site through telecommunications access via                                       the Internet.
perturbation.changed_text: the "Services"                  the services to be vaguely described and optionally performed by HealthGate, and may not be clearly set out in the Specification. These services could potentially include (i) intermittent work, if any, in the design and development of the Site; (ii) potentially placing the Content on HealthGate's Hardware; (iii) maybe making the Content and portions thereof electronically available; (iv) potentially allowing access to Subscribers under special consideration.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces vagueness and optionality where the original definition was specific and obligatory.  By using words like 'vaguely described', 'optionally performed', 'intermittent work', 'potentially', and 'maybe', the modified definition contradicts the intent of a service agreement, which typically requires clear and binding obligations.  It makes the scope of HealthGate's responsibilities unclear and unenforceable, deviating from industry standards of service agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles - Definiteness of Terms

perturbation.original_text: 12.4. HealthGate will perform the Services and meet the Specifications and             Service Levels set forth and referred to in this Agreement. In all             cases where HealthGate has not committed to a specific performance             standard, HealthGate will use reasonable care in providing the             Services.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.4. HealthGate will attempt to perform the Services as it understands them and meet some Specifications. In all             cases, HealthGate's provision of Services is at its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause sets a standard for performance ('perform the Services and meet the Specifications'). The modified clause weakens this obligation significantly by stating 'attempt to perform the Services as it understands them and meet some Specifications' and by stating the provision of services 'is at its sole discretion.' This creates a legal contradiction by undermining the explicit obligations set forth in the contract, potentially rendering the service agreement unenforceable. It conflicts with principles requiring good faith and reasonable effort in contract performance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles - Good Faith and Reasonable Effort
